metadata.title: Openshift: ClusterIP Service TLS certificate not checked by route controller if re-encrypt Route destinationCACertificate field is explicitly set to default serviceCA (moderate)
metadata.description: DOCUMENTATION: An Improper Certificate Validation attack was found in Openshift. A re-encrypt Route with destinationCACertificate explicitly set to the default serviceCA skips internal Service TLS certificate validation. This flaw allows an attacker to exploit an invalid certificate, resulting in a loss of confidentiality.

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 is installed
openshift is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
